(?i)\\bmd5\\b: Use of insecure hash function. Use a stronger hashing algorithm such as SHA-256.
(?i)\\bsha1\\b: Use of insecure hash function. Use a stronger hashing algorithm such as SHA-256.
(?i)\\brc4\\b: Use of insecure encryption algorithm. Use a stronger encryption algorithm such as AES-256.
(?i)\\bdes\\b: Use of weak encryption algorithm. Use a stronger encryption algorithm such as AES-256.
(?i)\\brc2\\b: Use of weak encryption algorithm. Use a stronger encryption algorithm such as AES-256.
(?i)\\bplaintext\\b: Use of plaintext data transmission. Encrypt data in transit using SSL/TLS.
(?i)\\bftp\\b: Use of insecure network protocol. Use a more secure protocol such as SFTP or FTPS.
(?i)\\btelnet\\b: Use of insecure network protocol. Use a more secure protocol such as SSH.
(?i)\\brlogin\\b: Use of insecure network protocol. Use a more secure protocol such as SSH.
(?i)\\brsh\\b: Use of insecure network protocol. Use a more secure protocol such as SSH.
(?i)\\btftp\\b: Use of insecure network protocol. Use a more secure protocol such as SFTP or FTPS.
(?i)\\bsendmail\\b: Sendmail is a legacy email server that is no longer maintained and may have security vulnerabilities. Use a more modern email server such as Postfix or Exim.
(?i)\\bsmtp\\b: SMTP is an insecure email protocol that sends emails in plain text. Use a more secure protocol such as SMTPS or STARTTLS.
(?i)\\bpassword\\b[^,]*[,{]((?!private_k: SSH connection should use private key instead of password.
(?i)\\bpassword\\b[^,]*[,{].*\\bssh\\b[^: SSH connection should use private key instead of password.
(?i)\\bpassword\\b[^,]*[,{].*\\bwinrm\\b: WinRM connection should use HTTPS protocol and client certificate authentication.
